intro: Ruehssia hatschbachii, commonly known as the Bornean ruehssia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a slightly glossy appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
